billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO MENTAL HEALTH AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES

title: Relates to the administration of certain nutritional supplements to persons residing in facilities operated or regulated by the office for people with developmental disabilities
summary: Requires the administration of certain nutritional supplements to persons residing in facilities operated or regulated by the office of people with developmental disabilities when prescribed by a licensed physician; requires medicaid reimbursement.

       Introduced  by  Sen. BONACIC -- read twice and ordered printed, and when

       AN ACT to amend the mental hygiene law and the social services  law,  in
         relation  to  the administration of certain nutritional supplements to
         persons residing in facilities operated or regulated by the office for
         people with developmental disabilities

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  13.07  of  the  mental hygiene law is amended by
    2  adding a new subdivision (f) to read as follows:
    3    (F) THE OFFICE SHALL PROVIDE FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF DIETARY SUPPLE-
    4  MENTS FOR PERSONS RESIDING IN INTERMEDIATE FACILITIES OPERATED, LICENSED
    5  OR REGULATED BY THE OFFICE, WHERE SUCH  SUPPLEMENTS  ARE  PRESCRIBED  AS
    6  MEDICALLY  NECESSARY  BY  A PHYSICIAN LICENSED TO PRACTICE IN THIS STATE
    7  AND ARE APPROVED PURSUANT TO SECTION THREE HUNDRED SIXTY-FIVE-A  OF  THE
    8  SOCIAL  SERVICES  LAW.  SUCH FACILITIES SHALL NOT BE REQUIRED TO INCLUDE
    9  THE ADMINISTRATION OF DIETARY  SUPPLEMENTS  IN  THE  MEDICATION  REGIMEN
   10  REVIEW REQUIRED TO BE CONDUCTED PURSUANT TO REGULATIONS OF THE OFFICE OR
   11  RULES ADOPTED BY THE FACILITY. NO INTERMEDIATE CARE FACILITY SHALL ADOPT
   12  RULES  PROHIBITING  THE  ADMINISTRATION  OF NUTRITIONAL SUPPLEMENTS THAT
   13  MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
   14    S 2. Subdivision 2 of section 365-a of  the  social  services  law  is
   15  amended by adding a new paragraph (w) to read as follows:
   16    (W) DIETARY SUPPLEMENTS WHICH ARE PRESCRIBED AS MEDICALLY NECESSARY BY
   17  A PHYSICIAN LICENSED TO PRACTICE IN THIS STATE AND WHICH ARE PROVIDED TO
   18  INDIVIDUALS   RESIDING  IN  INTERMEDIATE  CARE  FACILITIES  OPERATED  OR
   19  LICENSED BY THE OFFICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.
   20    S 3. Paragraph (a) of subdivision 4 of section  365-a  of  the  social
   21  services  law, as amended by chapter 493 of the laws of 2010, is amended
   22  to read as follows:

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06096-01-1

       S. 2770                             2

    1    (a) drugs which may be dispensed without a prescription as required by
    2  section sixty-eight hundred ten of the education law; provided, however,
    3  that the state commissioner of health may by regulation specify  certain
    4  of  such  drugs which may be reimbursed as an item of medical assistance
    5  in  accordance with the price schedule established by such commissioner.
    6  Notwithstanding any other provision of law, additions  to  the  list  of
    7  drugs  reimbursable  under this paragraph may be filed as regulations by
    8  the commissioner of health without prior notice and  comment.  PROVIDED,
    9  FURTHER,  HOWEVER,  THAT  DIETARY  SUPPLEMENTS  WHICH  ARE PRESCRIBED AS
   10  MEDICALLY NECESSARY BY A PHYSICIAN LICENSED TO PRACTICE  IN  THIS  STATE
   11  AND  WHICH  ARE  PROVIDED  TO  INDIVIDUALS RESIDING IN INTERMEDIATE CARE
   12  FACILITIES OPERATED OR LICENSED BY THE OFFICE FOR PEOPLE  WITH  DEVELOP-
   13  MENTAL  DISABILITIES,  SHALL BE REIMBURSED AS AN ITEM OF MEDICAL ASSIST-
   14  ANCE;
   15    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
